comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-87) (MYAIR-2975)

# 1. If the user has been registered for 30 nights or longer, the user shall be able to see the AHI for each of the most recent 30 nights inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".

# 2. If the user has been registered for less than 30 nights, the user shall be able to see the AHI for each of the nights the user has been registered inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".
# 3. Monte Carlo shall show how the AHI score is calculated
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: User should be able to see AHI events less than 30 nights.

steps.name: I have "5" days of sleep data
I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "Events history" button
I should see the "AHI History" values for 5 days

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-87) (MYAIR-2975)

# 1. If the user has been registered for 30 nights or longer, the user shall be able to see the AHI for each of the most recent 30 nights inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".

# 2. If the user has been registered for less than 30 nights, the user shall be able to see the AHI for each of the nights the user has been registered inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".
# 3. Monte Carlo shall show how the AHI score is calculated
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: User should only see AHI events for nights with data

steps.name: I have "7" days of sleep data
I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "Events history" button
I should see the "AHI History" values for 7 days

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the badge icon appears over the Dashboard tab following a "Score tip" push notification when on the Settings, and removed when navigating to the "Dashboard" screen

steps.name: I open the app on the "My notifications" screen
a "ScoreTip" push notification is received
I navigate back to the "Profile" screen
I should see a badge icon on the "Dashboard" tab
I tap the "Dashboard" tab
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen
I should not see a badge icon on the "Dashboard" tab

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-801) (MYAIR-1330)
# 1. The user shall be able to check for new coaching content from Patient Portal

# 2. When the user visits coaching and the coaching section has not been updated for more than 1 hour, then the coaching shall be requested from Patient Portal (note: does not include opening from a coaching Push notification)
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-153) (MYAIR-101)
# 1. The user shall be shown the coaching assets that have been generated from Patient Portal since registration
# 2. The coaching shall be shown chronologically from the most recent item to the oldest item
# 3. Selecting a video shall start the video
# NOTE: For iOS we have "More" screen and for android is "Settings" screen

# NOTE: Testing for coaching update by tagging push notifications will be tested in MYAIR-1060 story. These following scenarios do not apply to the case of accessing coaching from push notification item

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account with coaching data
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: There have not been any coaching tip updates for an hour, so if the user returns to Coaching from the More screen, the app should still receive a call from patient portal by automatic page refresh

steps.name: I open the app on the "Coaching Timeline" screen
I wait for coaching sync
I should see the current "Coaching Timeline" content
I navigate to the "Profile" screen
it has been "61" minutes since last coaching sync
Patient Portal responses are delayed by "5" seconds for "1" response
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
Coaching Content should be requested
I should see the current "Coaching Timeline" content

name: Coaching History and when to update

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-694) (MCA-2048)
# 1. Each sleep score shall be accompanied with a message according to the following rules:
# | requirement id | Condition                               | Text                                                                      | Notes                                                     |
# | 1a             | Usage is greater than 7 hours           | Excellent results, name! As you start to see the benefits in your life,   | name is replaced with the user's first name               |
# |                |                                         | you’ll never look back.                                                   |                                                           |
# | 1b             | Usage is less than or equal to 7 hours  | That's a great score! You're well on your way to improving your health.   |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 4 hours                |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1c             | Usage is less than or equal to 4 hours  | Good start! Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy will    |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 2 hours                | get easier the more you practice.                                         |                                                           |
# | 1d             | Usage is less than or equal to 2 hours  | Keep going name! If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out  | name is replaced with the users first name                |
# |                | and greater than 0 minutes              | support. Try the myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                 |                                                           |
# | 1e             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used last night! Do you need more support? Try the    |                                                           |
# |                | for the latest sleep record             | myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                                  |                                                           |
# | 1f             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used this night.                                      |                                                           |
# |                | not for the latest sleep record         |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1g             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | Last night's data isn't available yet.                                    |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there is data for the       |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | previous sleep record, or this is the   |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | only sleep record available             |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1h             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time. To ensure     |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there has been no data for  | that your machine can send data, review the tips on the Missing Data page.|                                                           |
# |                | the most recent 2 or more sleep records |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1i             | No data, score is not for the latest    | myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.               |                                                           |
# |                | sleep record                            |                                                                           |                                                           |
# Note: Monte Carlo only receives the number of therapy sessions per sleep record and does not know when each therapy session starts and ends.
# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when running 7 hours 1 minute of therapy, applicable message appears

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "Excellent results, Jane!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "As you start to see the benefits in your life, you'll never look back." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: As you start to see the benefits in your life, you'll never look back.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3537) (MYAIR-3930)
#  1.  Given the patient is signed-in and already has a device registered with their account, then the App shall allow the patient to change the device registered with their account
#  Note: See MCA-3536 for device registration requirements
# For testing Use these Values:
#    Existing Account : test.resmed11+139@gmail.com / Resmed123  (Default Device = 69362761035 )
#    Updated Device Serial : 56855204271
# V5 Patient Portal Endpoints : https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/V5+Patient+Portal+Endpoints
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3002)(MCA-2536)
# 1. If the user has an AirSense in their account, then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine that is provided by Patient Portal
# 2. In the event Patient Portal returns last sync time as "1900-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine as "-"
# Note 1: By default the App displays "-" for last sync time (i.e. sync has yet to occur).
# Note 2: Example format for displaying last sync time is Jan 12, 1952 3:30 PM
# Note 3: Date and time is based on the phone's local date and time
# Note:  All the test scenarios in this feature file require usage of the Patient Portal server
# Mock uses the following serial numbers / devices numbers / make / models for responses
# | Serial Number | Device Number | Made By            | Model                          | Notes                 |
# | 78899898308   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 Autoset            | * Default in mock     |
# | 56221828959   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her    |                       |

steps.name: I enable Wifi
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Patient attempts to update Device by providing a valid device number with matching serial number for a Device that does not support myAir, then app informs the user that the device cannot be updated

steps.name: I open the app on the "My equipment" screen
I tap the "Update machine" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I enter "12314123234" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "123" into the "Device number" field
Patient Portal will return a "14" response error code
I tap the "Save" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I should see the text "The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again."

arguments.val: The serial number and/or the device number entered is not valid. Please try again.

arguments.val: The link to activate my account expired. Now what?

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-4530) (MYAIR-4992)
# 1. Given the patient lives outside of France and Japan, when the patient chooses to register, then the App shall request their marketing outreach preference
# 2. For US, the App shall default Marketing outreach preference to enabled (i.e. opt-out)
# 3. For all other countries, the App shall default Marketing outreach preference to disabled (i.e. opt-in)

elements.name: When the Patient creates an account and lives outside of France and Japan, marketing consent is disabled by default. If left disabled, it is disabled in the request to Patient Portal.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Welcome" screen
I tap the "Create an account" button
I should be on the "Country Selection" screen
I tap "Country selection CA"
I should be on the "Create account" screen
I should see the "Registration Marketing Outreach" checkbox is not checked
I fill out all the required registration fields
I tap the "Send activation email" button
I should be on the "Activate Account" screen
the app sent a patient registration request with marketing outreach disabled

elements.name: When the Patient creates an account and lives outside of France and Japan, marketing consent is disabled by default. If enabled, it is enabled in the request to Patient Portal.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Welcome" screen
I tap the "Create an account" button
I should be on the "Country Selection" screen
I tap "Country selection CA"
I should be on the "Create account" screen
I should see the "Registration Marketing Outreach" checkbox is not checked
I fill out all the required registration fields
I tap the "Registration Marketing Outreach" button
I should see the "Registration Marketing Outreach" checkbox is checked
I tap the "Send activation email" button
I should be on the "Activate Account" screen
the app sent a patient registration request with marketing outreach enabled

elements.name: When the Patient lives in Japan, marketing consent is disabled.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Welcome" screen
I tap the "Create an account" button
I should be on the "Country Selection" screen
I tap "Country selection JP"
I should be on the "Create account" screen
I should not see the "Registration Marketing Outreach" field
I fill out all the required registration fields
I tap the "Send activation email" button
I should be on the "Activate Account" screen
the app sent a patient registration request with marketing outreach disabled

elements.name: When the Patient creates an account and lives outside of France and Japan, marketing consent is disabled by default. But for patient living in US it is enabled.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Welcome" screen
I tap the "Create an account" button
I should be on the "Country Selection" screen
I tap "Country selection US"
I should be on the "Create account" screen
I should see the "Registration Marketing Outreach" checkbox is checked
I fill out all the required registration fields
I tap the "Send activation email" button
I should be on the "Activate Account" screen
the app sent a patient registration request with marketing outreach enabled

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3350) (MYAIR-3791)
#1.  When a forthcoming scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient of the impending server outage
#2.  When a scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is down for scheduled maintenance
#3.  When an unscheduled partial outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 1: Occurs when AVX is down but Patient Portal is online
#4.  When an unscheduled outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 2: Occurs when Patient Portal is down or Patient Portal is unable to process App service request because AVX is down
#  Server notifies App of planned/unplanned outage, 4 different UI dialogs can appear for the 7 possible scenarios:
#  Dialog #1 (planned active)
#  1) PP planned outage active
#  2) AV planned outage active
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #2 (partial outage)
#  3) AV unplanned outage
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #3 (total outage)
#  4) PP unplanned outage
#  5) AV unplanned outage which prevents PP from completing any part of request
#  Note: string hard-coded in App
#  Dialog #4 (planned upcoming)
#  6) PP planned outage upcoming
#  7) AV planned outage upcoming
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
# Notes: For Android testing purposes use these to generate the Outages
#AC 1: Dialog 4: Planned outage Upcoming - Scheduled Full Outage / Scheduled Partial Outage
#AC 2: Dialog 1: Planned Active Outage - Active Partial Outage
#AC 3: Dialog 2: Unplanned Partial Outage - Active Partial Outage
#AC 4: Dialog 3: Unplanned Total Outage - Active Full Outage (this is just 503/404 HTTP Response )
# Reference page: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MYAIR/Monaco+Interface+with+Patient+Portal#MonacoInterfacewithPatientPortal-ServerOutages

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: The user should receive "Upcoming Outage Notification" when Patient Portal send the notification to the user for Schedule Full Outage

steps.name: I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal will send an "scheduled full" outage notification
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I should see the "myAir is scheduled to be offline for system maintenance" dialog

arguments.val: myAir is scheduled to be offline for system maintenance

#1.  When a forthcoming scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient of the impending server outage
#2.  When a scheduled maintenance outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is down for scheduled maintenance
#3.  When an unscheduled partial outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 1: Occurs when AVX is down but Patient Portal is online
#4.  When an unscheduled outage notification is received from the server, the App shall inform the patient the server is experiencing issues
#Note 2: Occurs when Patient Portal is down or Patient Portal is unable to process App service request because AVX is down
#  Server notifies App of planned/unplanned outage, 4 different UI dialogs can appear for the 7 possible scenarios:
#  Dialog #1 (planned active)
#  1) PP planned outage active
#  2) AV planned outage active
#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint
#  Dialog #2 (partial outage)

#  Note: string supplied by server endpoint

#  5) AV unplanned outage which prevents PP from completing any part of request

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-187)
# Note 1: This card deals with the general use case scenario. Activation errors and retries will be handled in another card.
# Note 2: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# Note 3: This card requires that an api call is made to login service
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2309) (MYAIR-3226)
# 1. After the first successful login of a user, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. date and time that the app was first used
# 1b. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-131)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-347)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-219)
# Note 1: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated and the account is active, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-747)
# 1. On every login, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. push token (if user is logged in and push is enabled)
# 1b. platform (i.e. iOS)
# 1c. date and time that the app was first used
# 1d. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-147) (MYAIR-355)
# Note 1: This card deals with the scenario when the user has entered incorrect login details multiple times.
# 1. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be told to wait and try again
# 2. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to enter log in credentials
# 3. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to start the reset password workflow
# Note: Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario because local Patient Portal server accepts all username and password input.

steps.name: I install the app for the first time
I open the app on the "Signin" screen

comments.value: # Note:  Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario because local Patient Portal server accepts all username and password input.

elements.name: If the patient entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email they entered they will be notified that the username or password is invalid.

steps.name: Patient Portal will send an invalid password response
I enter "test.user1640@gmail.com" into the "Email" field
I enter "123456789" into the "Password" field
I press the "Sign In" button
I see the text "Email or password is invalid"

name: log in, sending data to Patient Portal during login, and forgot password

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: You can navigate forward and see the corresponding sleep scores.  Also when user navigates to Dashboard, the default sleep record displayed is the most recent sleep record because it has sleep data.

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I see the score for most recent sleep record
I navigate to 4 sleep records back
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores
I navigate to 1 sleep record forward
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores
I navigate to 2 sleep records forward
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores
I navigate to 1 sleep record forward
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: When user navigates to Dashboard, the default sleep record displayed is last night (yesterday) and the sleep record with no sleep data has "-" for its scores.

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Score" screen
I wait for data sync
I see the score for most recent sleep record
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1284)

# 1. Given the system Push setting has changed since Monte Carlo was last in the foreground, when Monte Carlo is launched or opened, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the Push status and token
# 2. Given Push is enabled in the system settings, when the push setting is changed in the profile, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the Push status and token
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-804)

#  1. Given the Push token has been updated or not previously sent to Patient Portal, when Monte Carlo is launched or opened and user is logged-in, Monte Carlo shall send the Push token to Patient Portal
#  2. Given App Notifications are turned on in the phone settings, when the push setting is changed in the profile, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the app Push setting and token
# Note for Android: Use this command to validate that the token is the same as the patient portal support:   adb logcat -v time | egrep "Refreshed token:"
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. (   https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: Only "Android": "Push token is updated on the app" - To Trigger >> Test Support >> test actions >> refresh firebase token

# Note 3: When testing manually: to verify that the Push Token is sent to Patient Portal, sign into the support site from Note 1, and check that the push token for the device used in the test is listed.

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "My notifications" screen

comments.value: # Note: Background steps are sufficient on the Patient-side for this test
# The push token received on the myAir Support Website should be the same seen on the logcat for android ( adb logcat -v time | egrep "Refreshed token:" )
# For this scenario, it is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user

elements.name: Product owner sees push notification token and status in Patient Portal Profile

steps.name: I toggle the "Push notifications Coaching" switch on
the Push token has been uploaded to Patient Portal

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1284)

# 1. Given the system Push setting has changed since Monte Carlo was last in the foreground, when Monte Carlo is launched or opened, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the Push status and token
# 2. Given Push is enabled in the system settings, when the push setting is changed in the profile, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the Push status and token
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-804)

#  1. Given the Push token has been updated or not previously sent to Patient Portal, when Monte Carlo is launched or opened and user is logged-in, Monte Carlo shall send the Push token to Patient Portal
#  2. Given App Notifications are turned on in the phone settings, when the push setting is changed in the profile, Monte Carlo shall update Patient Portal with the app Push setting and token
# Note for Android: Use this command to validate that the token is the same as the patient portal support:   adb logcat -v time | egrep "Refreshed token:"
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. (   https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: Only "Android": "Push token is updated on the app" - To Trigger >> Test Support >> test actions >> refresh firebase token

# Note 3: When testing manually: to verify that the Push Token is sent to Patient Portal, sign into the support site from Note 1, and check that the push token for the device used in the test is listed.

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "My notifications" screen

comments.value: # Please see Note 2
# The push token received on the myAir Support Website should be the same seen on the logcat for android ( adb logcat -v time | egrep "Refreshed token:" )
# For this scenario, it is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user

elements.name: User enables push notifications in the app through Coaching. Product owner sees changes in push notification token and status in Patient Portal Profile

steps.name: I toggle the "Push notifications Coaching" switch on
the Push token has been uploaded to Patient Portal
I uninstall and reinstall the app
I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Allow" button
I should see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
the Push token has been uploaded to Patient Portal

name: Update Push Status with Patient Portal

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2367) (MYAIR-3228)
# 1. The first time I open the app after an update, I can learn about the new features for this release

elements.name: The user should be able to view What's New screen after app update while logged in

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I update the app version
I open the app
I should be on the "What's New" screen
I see new features for this release
I tap the "Continue" button
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

steps.name: I update the app version
I open the app
I should be on the "What's New" screen
I see new features for this release
I tap the "Continue" button
I should be on the "Welcome" screen

elements.name: The user should not be able to view What's New screen after clean install

I launch the app for the first time
I should be on the "Welcome" screen
I sign in with an existing account
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen
